metadata.feature_description: Displays top community contributors with their engagement metrics and avatars

steps.action: Logged in as SuperUser and navigated to PersonaBar > Dashboard > Community Analytics
steps.expected: Community Analytics dashboard should display Top Spectators, Most Active Users, and Power Rankings sections with user avatars
steps.actual: Community Analytics panel opened showing module-specific dashboards (Answers, Blogs, Discussions, Events, Ideas, Wiki) but NO Top Users sections were visible

steps.action: Examined all visible sections and scrolled through the combined dashboard view
steps.expected: Top Community Users tables with avatars, display names, and engagement metrics should be visible
steps.actual: Only module-specific analytics (Community Health, Engagement, Creates & Views, Trending Tags, Popular Content) are displayed. No Top Spectators, Most Active Users, or Power Rankings sections found

steps.action: Used browser evaluation to search for community-users component or top user bindings in DOM
steps.expected: community-users component or related data bindings should be present in the rendered HTML
steps.actual: No community-users components, topCommunity classes, or topSpectators/mostActiveUsers/powerRankings bindings found in the rendered DOM

issues: The community-users Knockout component exists in code (communityUsers.js) but is not included in any HTML template
JavaScript files populate topSpectators, mostActiveUsers, and powerRankings observables but no HTML binds to them
CSS styles for .topCommunity exist but the HTML elements are never rendered
Feature appears to be incomplete or removed from UI while backend code was retained

test_scenarios.scenario_name: Navigate to user profiles on click

steps.action: Attempted to find clickable user rows in Top Users section
steps.expected: User rows should be clickable and navigate to user profile via utility.loadPanel('users', params)
steps.actual: Cannot test - Top Users section is not visible in the UI

issues: Feature not testable - UI component not rendered

steps.action: Attempted to view user engagement metrics and values with tooltips
steps.expected: Each user should display a value (abbreviated number) with full value in tooltip
steps.actual: Cannot test - Top Users section is not visible in the UI

issues: Feature not testable - UI component not rendered

test_scenarios.scenario_name: Test empty state when no users

steps.action: Attempted to verify empty state message when no community users data available
steps.expected: Should display 'No data available' message (topCommunity_NoDataAvailable resource string exists)
steps.actual: Cannot test - Top Users section is not visible in the UI

issues: Feature not testable - UI component not rendered

steps.action: Attempted to verify avatar display and potential fallback behavior
steps.expected: User avatars should display with proper fallback handling
steps.actual: Cannot test - Top Users section is not visible in the UI

issues: Feature not testable - UI component not rendered

steps.action: Attempted to change time period and compare user rankings/metrics
steps.expected: User metrics should update when period changes (Week, Month, Year, Custom)
steps.actual: Cannot test - Top Users section is not visible in the UI

issues: Feature not testable - UI component not rendered

observations: Code analysis confirms the Top Community Users feature is fully implemented in JavaScript (communityUsers.js Knockout component, social-dashboard-instance.js, social-dashboard-combined-instance.js)
The feature was designed to display three user rankings: Top Spectators, Most Active Users, and Power Rankings
Each user would show: avatar image, display name, and engagement value with tooltip
The API endpoint GetDashboardInfo returns topSpectators, mostActiveUsers, and powerRankings data
Resource strings exist for all labels (col_TopSpectators, col_MostActiveUsers, col_PowerRankings, topCommunity_NoDataAvailable)
CSS styles exist in social-dashboard.css and social-dashboard-combined.css for .topCommunity class
CRITICAL: Neither social-dashboard.html nor social-dashboard-combined.html contain the HTML bindings to render this component
The community-users Knockout component is registered but never used in any HTML template
This appears to be an incomplete feature implementation or a feature that was removed from the UI layer while the backend code was preserved
The current Community Analytics UI only shows module-specific dashboards without an overview/summary view containing Top Users
